PAD_Sign_001.synopsis: Started when passing an arcana check to discern the meaning of the sigil on the mind-draining machine above its respective lever. In this case it turns the mind slaves hostile.

PAD_PodStorage.synopsis: If the gith guide is not present, player will comment on the mass mindflayer pod storage upon entering the room.

DrainVictim000.synopsis: Player notices the victims are not responsive. Their minds have been drained.

PAD_ControlPanel.synopsis: Player remarks on levers in a room. Not sure what the levers might initiate.

PAD_ChairWhispers.synopsis: This AD triggers when players decide to sit on one of the chairs in the mindflayer room. The idea is that they hear voices from the nautiloid as if it was communciating with them.
PAD_ChairWhispers.how_to_trigger: Interact with the chairs like the one in TUT_Avernus_C 50; 17; -359

PAD_FreedSlavesDead.synopsis: The player tried to free some mindflayer thralls, but they're already dead

ShadowheartFollower.synopsis: Shadowheart's default dialogue while she's following the player during the tutorial. They've only just met, but given the dangerous situation they're in, there isn't much time for chit-chat.

AD_HostileUs.synopsis: AD oneliner for when after players have antagonized Us in the nautiloid and fled, He will appear in the mindflayer room with the other intellect devourer. When seeing players again, he will say this AD while entering combat.
AD_HostileUs.how_to_trigger: -Interact with Myrnath in TUT_Avernus_C 2; 21; -437-Manage to free Us from the skull, then attack him in dialogue-Let him reach the crevice in which he dissappears-He will teleport to 36; 18; -354 after a aprox 5 seconds then have him see you, being hostile and starting combat

AD_PodGirlCall.synopsis: AD when the player goes near the pod containing Shadowheart while she struggles to get out.

DrainVictim001.synopsis: Player looks at unresponsive mind-drained victim.

PAD_PodKeyFound.synopsis: The player finds a rune that was locked inside a chest on the nautiloid. They may or may not recognise that it fits in a socket in the inactive console next to Shadowheart's pod, located nearby in the same chamber.

PodGirl.synopsis: Occurs if the player clicks on the first mind flayer pod with someone inside. They can attempt to free the captive - Shadowheart - but the magical runes guarding the pod prevent this.The player can leave her stuck, or try to find another way to free her. Via a skillcheck or via Shadowheart herself, they may receive a clue to examine the console next to the pod.
PodGirl.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game 2. goto -1.66, 17.62, -345.723. Interact with the pod.

AD_LaezelControlPanel.synopsis: Walking into a room with a lot of levers and signs. Lae'zel warns the player not to go pulling levers willy nilly. Urgent and severe.

AD_AttackOnPod.synopsis: One liner AD for Lae'zel if another player attempts to hit a pod in the Nautiloid
AD_AttackOnPod.how_to_trigger: Have lae'zel and another character in your partyTeleport to TUT_Avernus_C 1; 17; -343Attack the pod with a character that's not Lae'zel and her being close

AD_AltGuide_PodStorage.synopsis: reaction to seeing the mass pod storage room.

AD_LaezelLeverResponse.synopsis: Lae'zel tells you off for pulling a dangerous lever on a mind flayer machine.

AD_ShadowheartFree.synopsis: Shadowheart's just been freed from her pod aboard the nautiloid, thanks to the player. She's fallen to her knees after being sealed in a constrictive tube for some time, and is now gathering herself/muttering to herself.

ShadowheartFreed.synopsis: Dialogue with SH after you free her from the pod aboard the nautiloid. You can bring her with you in a bid to escape together, or leave her to fend for herself. Different branches if the player is gith, looks like a gith or has a gith follower/companion. In each case, Shadowheart retrieves the Orpheus box towards the end of the diialogue from her pod, then joins the player or leaves by herself.
ShadowheartFreed.how_to_trigger: Recon goto 9 -352give S_TUT_TransformChamber_PodKeyUse Console near Shadowheart's Pod

AD_PatrollingIntDev.synopsis: AD when interacting with the intellect devourer that is patrolling between the mindflayer room where a human is in a pod and can be transformed into an illithid and the room where two other thralls are in chairs and can be killed or turned hostile by pressing buttons.The intellect devourer will recognize players as kin because of the tadpole, and without revealing too much mention how tadpoled people are being experimented on and turned into mindflayers.
AD_PatrollingIntDev.how_to_trigger: Interact with the patrolling intellect devourer in TUT_Avernus_C 36; 18; -354

PAD_Sign_005.synopsis: Started when passing an arcana check to discern the meaning of the sigil on the transformation machine above its respective lever. In this case transforming the people in the pods into mindflayers, i.e. 'perfecting' them

PAD_PodLockUnactivated.synopsis: The player interacts with an inactive console near Shadowheart's pod aboard the nautiloid, and notices a socket of sorts.

PAD_SlavesHostile.synopsis: When pulling the aggression lever on the mind draining device, the player observes the machine made them hostile.

AD_EmptySHPod.synopsis: Narrator AD if players interact with the empty pod where Shadowheart would have been if she was an NPC instead of an Avatar. It should be a generic comment concerning pods and the situation players find themselves in the nautiloid.
AD_EmptySHPod.how_to_trigger: Start game with SH avatar in TUT_Avernus_CInteract with pod in 1; 17; -343

AD_LaezelPodStorage.synopsis: Lae'zel's reaction to seeing the mass pod storage room.

PAD_Sign_003.synopsis: Started when passing an arcana check to discern the meaning of the sigil on the mind-draining machine above its respective lever. In this case stopping the mind draining and thus "freeing" the brain dead slaves.

AD_AltGuide_LeverResponse.synopsis: Losiir scoffs at you in disgust for pulling the dangerous lever of a mind flayer machine.

PAD_TransformationFinished.synopsis: PAD for when players interact with obstacles that prevent them from reaching Path of Hell, the outside area in the Nautiloid in tutorial.
PAD_TransformationFinished.how_to_trigger: Reach TUT_Avernus_C -17; 17; -429 and interact with on of the barrels.

SlavesFreed.synopsis: When freeing the mind slaves from the mind-draining machine, the player observes they are already brain dead and therefore cannot escape.

PAD_KeyFound.synopsis: Started when looting the reliquary key. Has a variation if a player has interacted with the reliquary before.

PAD_Sign_002.synopsis: Started when passing an arcana check to discern the meaning of the sigil on the mind-draining machine above its respective lever. In this case destroying the machine.

PAD_ChestLocked.synopsis: Started when trying to open the reliquary without the key.

PodLock.synopsis: The player interacts with a console that can be used to free Shadowheart from her pod. In order to use it correctly, they must first insert an activation rune (or be a magic user who passed an earlier arcana check that provided a clue about the console), then psionically connect with the console and command it to open the pod.

PAD_Sign_001_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Sign_001_0.context: NodeContext: Player can decipher the meaning of the lever

PAD_PodStorage_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PodStorage_0.context: NodeContext: In awe and disgust. Each is for a victim like you.

DrainVictim000_0.speaker: Narrator
DrainVictim000_0.text: *The man isn't dead, but he's totally unresponsive.*

DrainVictim000_2.speaker: Narrator
DrainVictim000_2.text: *You're but one step from oblivion's stupor yourself - still wading through your empty skull to think a single thought.*

PAD_ControlPanel_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ControlPanel_0.text: Mind flayer machinery. Better watch what I touch.

PAD_ChairWhispers_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ChairWhispers_0.text: It's the chair - it's connected to the ship. And the ship's connected to the mind flayers.

PAD_ChairWhispers_3.speaker: Player
PAD_ChairWhispers_3.text: Let's go before they realise we're out of our pods.

ShadowheartFollower_1.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower_1.text: Something the matter? Besides the obvious, that is.
ShadowheartFollower_1.context: NodeContext: 'the obvious' being that they're trying to escape a nautiloid flying through hell.

ShadowheartFollower_6.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFollower_6.text: My name is [GEN_PlayerName2_85df4a15-4d9b-4f68-0512-d104305d8dac], by the way.

ShadowheartFollower_11.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower_11.text: I'm Shadowheart. Enchanted to meet you - as much as circumstances allow.
ShadowheartFollower_11.context: NodeContext: Dry. The player's paused in the middle of a life or death situation to make introductions, and it's raised her eyebrow.

ShadowheartFollower_2.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower_2.text: Pondering my name won't get us off this ship. Let's stow the small talk until we're safe, shall we?

ShadowheartFollower_8.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFollower_8.text: Any suggestions for how to proceed?

ShadowheartFollower_10.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower_10.text: Well, jumping overboard is hardly an option - so that leaves us with taking control of this ship.
ShadowheartFollower_10.context: NodeContext: To the point and practical.

ShadowheartFollower_0.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower_0.text: Provided we can figure out how to do that, of course...

ShadowheartFollower_12.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower_12.text: You're keen to chat, for someone in mortal peril. What's the matter?
ShadowheartFollower_12.context: NodeContext: Dry, slightly terse at being interrupted again (this is the second or subsequent time the player's stopped to talk while they're still in danger).

AD_HostileUs_0.speaker: Us
AD_HostileUs_0.text: You are... not us. You must be terminated.

DrainVictim001_0.speaker: Narrator
DrainVictim001_0.text: *Life flickers in his eyes, but he seems totally unaware of his surroundings.*

DrainVictim001_1.speaker: Narrator
DrainVictim001_1.text: *A fleeting image washes over you... An unwashed operating table... your innards without.*

PAD_PodKeyFound_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PodKeyFound_1.text: This might unlock those controls next to the pod.

PodGirl_63.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_63.text: You! Get me out of this damn thing!
PodGirl_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart is pounding from the inside of the pod. The pod itself is covered in strange lines of silver, unlike the other pods (this is qualith)NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. She tries to get the player to free her.

PodGirl_31.speaker: Lae'zel
PodGirl_31.text: We have no time for stragglers.

PodGirl_95.speaker: Player
PodGirl_95.text: Look for a latch that might open the lid.

PodGirl_92.speaker: Narrator
PodGirl_92.text: *The construction is too alien. Nothing looks familiar.*

PodGirl_64.speaker: Player
PodGirl_64.text: There's no time - I need to get out of here.

PodGirl_3.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_3.text: Wait! Get me out of here, I can help you!
PodGirl_3.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

PodGirl_90.speaker: Losiir
PodGirl_90.text: Yes. Come - before it is too late.

PodGirl_73.speaker: Lae'zel
PodGirl_73.text: Good. Eyes up, and don't look back.

PodGirl_48.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

PodGirl_88.speaker: Us
PodGirl_88.text: No time. There is no time.

PodGirl_68.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_68.text: If you leave me, I'm dead. Please.

PodGirl_19.speaker: Player
PodGirl_19.text: The pod's stuck fast. I can't free you.

PodGirl_46.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_46.text: Wait! That can't be. There has to be another way. Please!
PodGirl_46.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

PodGirl_29.speaker: Losiir
PodGirl_29.text: We cannot die for one who is already doomed. Come.

PodGirl_9.speaker: Us
PodGirl_9.text: Safe if she stays. Safe if we go.

PodGirl_74.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

PodGirl_94.speaker: Player
PodGirl_94.text: I found some sort of key - it might free you.

PodGirl_2.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_2.text: Good - try using it on that machine next to me.
PodGirl_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances over. Detail shot of console Shadowheart is referring to.

PodGirl_21.speaker: Player
PodGirl_21.text: This thing's magically linked to that console - let me see what I can do.

PodGirl_32.speaker: Player
PodGirl_32.text: I'll go look around - there must be some way to get this thing open.

PodGirl_103.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_103.text: Try that contraption just next to the pod - they did something to it when they sealed me in.
PodGirl_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances over. Detail shot of console Shadowheart is referring to.

PodGirl_107.speaker: Player
PodGirl_107.text: Stay calm - I'll find a way to get this open.

PodGirl_44.speaker: Player
PodGirl_44.text: Grip the pod's lid and pull.

PodGirl_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player pulls on the pod's lid with both hands. It doesn't budge, and sends a shocking zap up their arms.

PodGirl_34.speaker: Losiir
PodGirl_34.text: Enough. Do we go, or do we die?

PodGirl_78.speaker: Lae'zel
PodGirl_78.text: This ship is crashing. Do you intend to die for a stranger?

PodGirl_76.speaker: Us
PodGirl_76.text: We must go. To the helm we must go!

PodGirl_45.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_45.text: Come on, there's got to be a way to open it!

PodGirl_82.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

PodGirl_35.speaker: Player
PodGirl_35.text: There's magic at work here. Determine what kind.

PodGirl_6.speaker: Narrator
PodGirl_6.text: *Warding runes - you feel them drawing energy from the console near to the pod.*

PodGirl_106.speaker: Losiir
PodGirl_106.text: This is madness. We cannot linger here.

PodGirl_85.speaker: Lae'zel
PodGirl_85.text: Are you satisfied? We need to go.

PodGirl_27.speaker: Us
PodGirl_27.text: Leave the one, the one must be left!

PodGirl_100.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_100.text: Keep trying! There's got to be something that'll open this!
PodGirl_100.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

PodGirl_99.speaker: Narrator
PodGirl_99.text: *The magic's configuration is like nothing you know. Nausea climbs further up your throat the longer you try to discern its nature.*

PodGirl_97.speaker: Player
PodGirl_97.text: Don't give up. Tear this thing open.
PodGirl_97.context: InternalNodeContext: Active check only available after the player previously chose N6 (grip the lid and pull)

PodGirl_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The barbarian player grips the pod lid and grimaces as they're shocked again. They heave and yank the lid up. Sparks fly. The player stands back as shadowheart falls forward out of the pod.

PodGirl_54.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_54.text: You can't force it that way. Try something else, go look around - anything. Please!

PodGirl_108.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_108.text: What are you waiting for? Get this blasted tube open!
PodGirl_108.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

PodGirl_75.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_75.text: Come on, get me out of this thing!

PodGirl_98.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl_98.text: I will not die here. I cannot.
PodGirl_98.context: NodeContext: Angry, defiant, trying to convince herself.

AD_LaezelControlPanel_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelControlPanel_0.text: Istik - back! Touch nothing without knowing its purpose.

AD_AttackOnPod_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_AttackOnPod_0.text: Don't bother. You'll barely dent it.

AD_AltGuide_PodStorage_0.speaker: Losiir
AD_AltGuide_PodStorage_0.text: A pod for every victim. Disgusting.

AD_ShadowheartFree_0.speaker: Shadowheart
AD_ShadowheartFree_0.text: How long was I in there...?
AD_ShadowheartFree_0.context: NodeContext: A little breathless and relieved. Just been freed from a pod/glass coffin.

AD_ShadowheartFree_1.speaker: Shadowheart
AD_ShadowheartFree_1.text: I thought I was going to die in that blasted tube.
AD_ShadowheartFree_1.context: NodeContext: A little breathless and relieved. Just been freed from a pod/glass coffin.

AD_ShadowheartFree_2.speaker: Shadowheart
AD_ShadowheartFree_2.text: At last... thought I was done for.
AD_ShadowheartFree_2.context: NodeContext: A little breathless and relieved. Just been freed from a pod/glass coffin.

AD_ShadowheartFree_3.speaker: Shadowheart
AD_ShadowheartFree_3.text: Got to get up. Got to keep moving.
AD_ShadowheartFree_3.context: NodeContext: A little breathless and relieved. Just been freed from a pod/glass coffin.

ShadowheartFreed_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart is on her knees, having just been ejected from her pod. She gets to her feet

ShadowheartFreed_88.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_88.text: I thought that damn thing was going to be my coffin. Thank you -
ShadowheartFreed_88.context: NodeContext: Relieved at being free - cut off at the end (by a mindmeld)

ShadowheartFreed_13.speaker: Narrator
ShadowheartFreed_13.text: *Your mind lurches into her thoughts. Her gratitude is mixed with wariness - because you look like a gith.*
ShadowheartFreed_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meldInternalNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meld

ShadowheartFreed_22.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_22.text: You're a gith... why did you help me?

ShadowheartFreed_101.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_101.text: And you expect what in return exactly? Githyanki aren't given to charity.

ShadowheartFreed_57.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_57.text: That's what your kind does - they take. Still... you did help me.

ShadowheartFreed_61.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_61.text: You may prove useful to me in getting off this ship - as a decoy in battle, perhaps.

ShadowheartFreed_4.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_4.text: Sounds in line with what I've heard about your kind.

ShadowheartFreed_28.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_28.text: I'm grateful, but don't expect me to be your pawn just because you freed me.

ShadowheartFreed_6.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_6.text: We both need all the help we can get. Let's try to get off this thing together.

ShadowheartFreed_62.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_62.text: What could the likes of you possibly know of my people?

ShadowheartFreed_1.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_1.text: I know enough. But I'll risk it over certain death.
ShadowheartFreed_1.context: NodeContext: Spoken with some aggression.She's convinced gith are bad news.

ShadowheartFreed_64.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_64.text: We are finished. Be on your way, elf. Survive if you can.

ShadowheartFreed_65.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_65.text: Half-elf. Better I go alone, actually. A group your size would slow me down...

ShadowheartFreed_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reaches into her pod and fetches an ornate box. She quickly puts it away, and leaves

ShadowheartFreed_34.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_34.text: Half-elf. And maybe we should travel together for now... in the interest of survival.

ShadowheartFreed_12.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_12.text: First you beg for help, then cast suspicion on me, and now you want to join me? You are an odd one.

ShadowheartFreed_92.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_92.text: I suppose I am. Fitting company for a decidedly odd situation, wouldn't you say?
ShadowheartFreed_92.context: NodeContext: Little bit of wry self-awareness. 'Yes I know I can seem difficult'.

ShadowheartFreed_24.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_24.text: We both need to get off this thing. Let's help each other.

ShadowheartFreed_26.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_26.text: Very well, come with me. But if you prove a burden, I will leave you behind.

ShadowheartFreed_94.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_94.text: Wait - looks like you've a full complement already. We'd make for easy targets, all grouped together like that.

ShadowheartFreed_72.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_72.text: I think I'll take my chances alone if it's all the same - less conspicuous. Good luck - and thank you.

ShadowheartFreed_35.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_35.text: Wait - you're not actually the one in charge of this group, are you? No offence, but I need to speak to a leader. Someone who knows where they're going.

ShadowheartFreed_50.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_50.text: I'll have to do, for now.

ShadowheartFreed_29.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_29.text: I'm afraid not. Good luck to you - I'll take my chances alone.

ShadowheartFreed_80.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_80.text: I've changed my mind. Find your own way off this ship.

ShadowheartFreed_86.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_86.text: Gladly. And best of luck. You'll need it.

ShadowheartFreed_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reaches into her pod and fetches an ornate box. She quickly puts it away.|

ShadowheartFreed_85.speaker: Lae'zel
ShadowheartFreed_85.text: Enough of this chatter. We need to get to the helm - now.
ShadowheartFreed_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart throws a suspicous look at Lae'zel NodeContext: Impatient

ShadowheartFreed_83.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks at  the player again (had glanced suspiciously at Lae'zel on previous node)

ShadowheartFreed_44.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_44.text: There's no time to spare. Lead the way.
ShadowheartFreed_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart is looking at the player (ie no Lae'zel inclusion occurred).NodeContext: Resolute.

ShadowheartFreed_89.speaker: Lae'zel
ShadowheartFreed_89.text: Finally. Let us make for the helm - we've wasted enough time already.
ShadowheartFreed_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart throws a suspicous look at Lae'zel NodeContext: Impatient

ShadowheartFreed_55.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_55.text: As I said, we are finished. Go.

ShadowheartFreed_69.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_69.text: Consider me gone. Maybe I'll see you around - if you survive, that is.

ShadowheartFreed_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reaches into her pod and fetches an ornate box. She quickly puts it away, and leaves

ShadowheartFreed_9.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_9.text: A curious tone, for one who owes her life to me.

ShadowheartFreed_82.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_82.text: Not so curious. I've heard what gith are like. Still... you did free me.

ShadowheartFreed_27.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_27.text: Did you feel that just now? We were in each other's heads.

ShadowheartFreed_18.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_18.text: I did... It must be because of those parasites they put in us...

ShadowheartFreed_38.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_38.text: We need to deal with that, but first we've to get off this thing... let's join up.

ShadowheartFreed_45.speaker: Narrator
ShadowheartFreed_45.text: *Your mind lurches into her thoughts. Her gratitude is mixed with wariness - because you have a gith with you.*
ShadowheartFreed_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meldInternalNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meld

ShadowheartFreed_31.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_31.text: Dangerous company's what you need in a fight.

ShadowheartFreed_93.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_93.text: Fair point. Looks like there's plenty of fighting ahead.

ShadowheartFreed_99.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_99.text: More that gith have a problem with everyone else. But there's more important matters right now - survival.

ShadowheartFreed_39.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_39.text: Did you feel that just now? We were in each other's heads.

ShadowheartFreed_78.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_78.text: They'll have to wait. I need to get off this ship alive first.

ShadowheartFreed_43.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_43.text: Let me come with you. We can get off this ship, and watch each other's backs along the way.
ShadowheartFreed_43.context: NodeContext: A little caution on 'watch each other's backs' - implying lingering distrust of the gith who's with them

ShadowheartFreed_0.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_0.text: All right then, let's get going. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

ShadowheartFreed_66.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_66.text: Did you feel what I felt just before? We were in each other's heads.

ShadowheartFreed_87.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_87.text: But that'll have to wait. Are we going to help each other, or not?

ShadowheartFreed_20.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_20.text: I've changed my mind - you're on your own.

ShadowheartFreed_53.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_53.text: Are you sure about that? Better odds of surviving if we help each other.

ShadowheartFreed_17.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_17.text: All right then, come on. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

ShadowheartFreed_75.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_75.text: Like I said, you're on your own.

ShadowheartFreed_21.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFreed_21.text: I'm used to it. Good luck... and thank you, for your help.
ShadowheartFreed_21.context: InternalNodeContext: SH runs off, not to be seen again until den recruitment.

ShadowheartFreed_23.speaker: Narrator
ShadowheartFreed_23.text: *Your mind lurches into her thoughts. You feel her gratitude, but also guardedness. And above all, a will to survive.*

ShadowheartFreed_19.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_19.text: I'm getting out of here. Follow me, if you can keep up.

ShadowheartFreed_58.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_58.text: Did you feel that just now? We were in each other's heads.

ShadowheartFreed_97.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFreed_97.text: You'd better get out of here - it's everyone for themselves.

AD_PatrollingIntDev_2.speaker: Intellect Devourer
AD_PatrollingIntDev_2.text: We will leave this terrible place. This hot place.

PAD_Sign_005_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Sign_005_1.context: NodeContext: per-FECT, the verb, not 'perfect' the adjective

PAD_PodLockUnactivated_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PodLockUnactivated_0.text: Whatever fits in that socket must power this thing.

AD_EmptySHPod_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_EmptySHPod_0.text: *Another pod, just like yours. How many more of these can there be?*

AD_LaezelPodStorage_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPodStorage_0.text: Tsk'va! How many hosts have these ghaik infected?
AD_LaezelPodStorage_0.context: NodeContext: shock at seeing so many pods. tsk-VA!

AD_AltGuide_ControlPanel_0.speaker: Losiir
AD_AltGuide_ControlPanel_0.text: Hands off those levers. Who's to say what they'll do?

SlavesFreed_0.speaker: Narrator
SlavesFreed_0.text: *Psionic energy radiates from the prisoners, but they do not react.*

PodLock_3.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Console has' active' audiovisual cues

PodLock_42.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_42.text: *But what is its purpose? Will it free the captive, or transform her like that other unfortunate?*

PodLock_31.speaker: Player
PodLock_31.text: Place your hand on the console again.

PodLock_22.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_22.text: *Suddenly you feel a hideous squirming in your head. The parasite.*
PodLock_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player lays their palm on the console and winces in discomfort.

PodLock_0.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_0.text: *Then discomfort fades, and another sensation washes over you. Connection. Authority.*
PodLock_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Expression of discomfort passes. Palm still at console

PodLock_8.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_8.text: *You feel the biomechanical brain of the console process your command... and yield to it.*
PodLock_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Palm still on the console

PodLock_39.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_39.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

PodLock_6.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_6.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

PodLock_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart falls out, landing on her hands and knees on the floor.

PodLock_21.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_21.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

PodLock_25.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_25.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

PodLock_51.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_51.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

PodLock_9.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_9.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

PodLock_56.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_56.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

PodLock_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player removes their palm from console

PodLock_55.speaker: Player
PodLock_55.text: Place your hand on the console.

PodLock_23.speaker: Player
PodLock_23.text: Take a closer look at the powered-up console.

PodLock_46.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_46.text: *The pulsing glow and organic lines of the device make it seem more like a beating heart than a machine.*
PodLock_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angle on powered-up console device

PodLock_5.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_5.text: *This device is different from the one that caused the other captive to transform. Perhaps it will open the nearby pod.*
PodLock_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angle on powered-up console deviceInternalNodeContext: If the player witnessed a woman in another pod transform into a mindflayer

PodLock_18.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_18.text: *Perhaps it will open the nearby pod.*
PodLock_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angle on powered-up console device

PodLock_28.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_28.text: *Nothing in the appearance of the device betrays its purpose. It could do anything.*
PodLock_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angle on powered-up console device

PodLock_1.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_1.text: *It could even transform the occupant of the pod, like what happened before.*
PodLock_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angle on powered-up console deviceInternalNodeContext: If the player witnessed a woman in another pod transform into a mindflayer

PodLock_35.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Console has' inactive' audiovisual cues

PodLock_37.speaker: Player
PodLock_37.text: Insert the rune into the socket.

PodLock_2.speaker: Player
PodLock_2.text: There's a socket in the console, shaped like the rune you found. Insert it.

PodLock_34.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_34.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player gesture: inserting rune into console socket (actual insertion doesn't need to be shown). 
SFX: console glows to life.

PodLock_40.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks down, puzzled (rune's missing/pickpocketed)

PodLock_38.speaker: Player
PodLock_38.text: Look for a switch or release.

PodLock_49.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_49.text: *The mechanisms are completely unrecognisable at first, but then you spy an empty socket.*
PodLock_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player peers at console, notices a socket (no need to show socket)

PodLock_53.speaker: Player
PodLock_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player mimes hitting the side of the console like it was an old out-of-tune TV

PodLock_32.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player mimes hitting the side of the console like it was an old out-of-tune TV, to no effect.

PodLock_11.speaker: Player
PodLock_11.text: Diffuse the warding magic by harmonising with its pitch and tone.

PodLock_41.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: Player mimes magicallty inscribing glyphs, console glows to life.

PodLock_26.speaker: Player
PodLock_26.text: Inscribe the device with the glyphs you sensed from the pod's warding runes.
PodLock_26.context: InternalNodeContext: The player passed an arcana check in the pod dialogue, unlocking this option

PodLock_4.speaker: Narrator
PodLock_4.text: *You feel the biomechanical brain of the console process your command... and reject it.*
PodLock_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player withdraws their hand from the console as if it burned them
